1.text: I beseech you therefore, brethren, by the mercies of God, to present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable to God, which is your spiritual service.

2.text: And be not fashioned according to this world: but be ye transformed by the renewing of your mind, that ye may prove what is the good and acceptable and perfect will of God.

3.text: For I say, through the grace that was given me, to every man that is among you, not to think of himself more highly than he ought to think; but so to think as to think soberly, according as God hath dealt to each man a measure of faith.

4.text: For even as we have many members in one body, and all the members have not the same office:

5.text: so we, who are many, are one body in Christ, and severally members one of another.

6.text: And having gifts differing according to the grace that was given to us, whether prophecy, let us prophesy according to the proportion of our faith;

7.text: or ministry, let us give ourselves to our ministry; or he that teacheth, to his teaching;

8.text: or he that exhorteth, to his exhorting: he that giveth, let him do it with liberality; he that ruleth, with diligence; he that showeth mercy, with cheerfulness.

9.text: Let love be without hypocrisy. Abhor that which is evil; cleave to that which is good.

10.text: In love of the brethren be tenderly affectioned one to another; in honor preferring one another;

11.text: in diligence not slothful; fervent in spirit; serving the Lord;

12.text: rejoicing in hope; patient in tribulation; continuing stedfastly in prayer;

13.text: communicating to the necessities of the saints; given to hospitality.

14.text: Bless them that persecute you; bless, and curse not.

15.text: Rejoice with them that rejoice; weep with them that weep.

16.text: Be of the same mind one toward another. Set not your mind on high things, but condescend to things that are lowly. Be not wise in your own conceits.

17.text: Render to no man evil for evil. Take thought for things honorable in the sight of all men.

18.text: If it be possible, as much as in you lieth, be at peace with all men.

19.text: Avenge not yourselves, beloved, but give place unto the wrath of God: for it is written, Vengeance belongeth unto me; I will recompense, saith the Lord.

20.text: But if thine enemy hunger, feed him; if he thirst, give him to drink: for in so doing thou shalt heap coals of fire upon his head.

21.text: Be not overcome of evil, but overcome evil with good.
